intro: Amphipogon restionaceus, commonly known as the slender restion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many species adapted to coastal and sandy environments. The plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with narrow, strap-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Amphipogon restionaceus is often found in fynbos vegetation, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils.
